docs.text: there was a time when john carpenter was a great horror director .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , his best film was 1978's masterpiece , " halloween , " but he also made 1980's " the fog , " and 1987's underrated , " prince of darkness . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: heck , he even made a good film in 1995 , with " in the mouth of madness . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but something terribly wrong happened to him in 1992 , with the terrible comedy , " memoirs of an invisible man . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: somehow , carpenter has lost his touch , with junk like his failed 1995 remake of , " village of the damned , " to his uninspired 1996 sequel , " escape from l . a . " those movies , however , look like cinematic works of art compared to his latest film , " john carpenter's vampires . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if i was him , i definately wouldn't want to put my own name in the title .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is a sad state of affairs when carpenter can make something as misguided and flatly written and filmed as , " vampires . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story is simple .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jack crow ( james woods ) is a vampire hunter who , along with one of his partners , montoya ( daniel baldwin ) , and a prostitute , katrina ( sheryl lee ) , survives an attack from the master vampire , valek ( thomas ian griffith ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since katrina was previously bitten by him , crow takes her along because anyone who is bitten by valek becomes telepathically linked to him until they themselves turn into vampires a couple days later , and crow is hoping to find him with the help of her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it seems valek's mission is to steal a black , wooden cross from a roman catholic church that will enable him to become so powerful that sunlight will not destroy him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: my question is : how many time have we seen this same story played out ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , the answer is just about as many times as a better version of the story has been made .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " john carpenter's vampires , " sadly enough , is one of the most unscary horror films i've ever seen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in fact , there isn't even one suspenseful moment in the whole 105-minute running time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the non-stop vampire attack sequences are stylelessly filmed , without any interesting camera work , which is usually a trademark of carpenter's .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and then we come to the screenplay , which , as far as i can tell , is nearly non-existent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there is no story development , and there isn't even an attempt to flesh out the characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: james woods can be a good actor , but he has nothing to do here but to say a couple of " pseudo " -clever lines of dialogue .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: daniel baldwin has some potential , but his character comes off as being very dense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and sheryl lee ( faring much better as laura palmer in " twin peaks " ) , like all of the female characters , plays an offensive stereotypical whore .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there is not an ounce of intelligence , or excitement in , " john carpenter's vamires , " which is very disheartening coming from an ex-fan of carpenter's .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he has said that he turned down directing , " halloween : h20 , " because he couldn't work up any excitement for it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and yet , when asked about a " vampires " sequel , he said he would be happy to do it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think that's a definite sign that carpenter has finally lost any trace of his lasting talent , not to mention a significant number of iq points .
docs.label: negative
